description: 대량 처리 12스테이지 - 비교급, 약속표현, 수동태, 조건문 중심

stages.title: 비교급/최상급 — 형용사·부사 기본
stages.intent: 형용사·부사의 비교급/최상급을 자연스럽게 말하고, than/the most와 함께 비교 표현을 정확히 구성한다.
lexset: big, small, fast, slow, expensive, cheap, good, bad, far, old, young, tall, short, easy, difficult
traps: 이중 비교급(more better ✗ → better)
불규칙 변화(good→better→best, bad→worse→worst)
than 누락(bigger me ✗ → bigger than me)
최상급 정관사(most expensive ✗ → the most expensive)

seeds.en: This is the most delicious in the world.

seeds.kr: 너는 더 빨리 달릴 수 있어.

seeds.en: She is the smartest among us.

stages.title: 약속·예약·제안 — Let's/Shall we/Would you like
stages.intent: 약속 잡기, 예약하기, 제안하기를 Let's/Shall we/Would you like to로 자연스럽게 말하고 응답한다.
lexset: meet, have lunch/dinner, go out, make a reservation, book, schedule, arrange, plan, suggest, invite
traps: Let's vs Shall we 혼동(Let's go vs Shall we go?)
Would you like + to 구조(Would you like go ✗)
응답 매칭(Yes, let's vs Yes, I'd like to)
시간 전치사(at 3 o'clock, on Monday)

seeds.en: Would you like to have coffee?

stages.title: 수량표현 확장 — some/any/much/many + How much/many
stages.intent: 가산/불가산명사와 some/any/much/many를 정확히 구분하고, How much/many로 수량을 자연스럽게 묻는다.
lexset: water, coffee, milk, money, time, people, books, chairs, advice, information, rice, bread
traps: 가산/불가산 혼동(How many water ✗)
some/any 문맥(긍정 some, 부정/의문 any)
much/many 선택(much people ✗)
불가산명사 복수(advices ✗ → advice)

seeds.en: How much water do you drink?
Can I have some more coffee?
How many chairs do you need?

stages.title: 장소·시간 전치사 심화 — at/in/on/by/for/during
stages.intent: 시간과 장소 전치사(at/in/on/by/for/during)를 상황에 맞게 정확히 선택하여 자연스럽게 말한다.
lexset: morning, afternoon, evening, Monday, weekend, home, office, school, station, airport, corner
traps: 시간 전치사 혼동(in the morning, on Monday, at 3 o'clock)
장소 전치사 선택(at home vs in the house)
by vs until 차이(by 5 o'clock vs until 5 o'clock)
for vs during 구분(for 2 hours vs during the meeting)

seeds.en: The phone rang during the meeting.
What do you do on weekends?
Are you free in the evening?
I'll pick you up at the airport.

stages.title: like to / like -ing / would like 구분
stages.intent: like to do, like doing, would like to의 의미와 뉘앙스 차이를 이해하고 상황에 맞게 선택하여 말한다.
lexset: read, watch, play, listen, travel, cook, study, exercise, shop, dance, swim, sing
traps: like + to vs -ing 혼동
would like + -ing 오류(would like going ✗)
일반적 취향 vs 즉시 원하는 것 구분
정중함 정도(like vs would like)

seeds.en: I would like to watch a movie.
I would like to have coffee.
What would you like to do?

stages.title: There is/are 확장 — 수량·형용사·전치사 결합
stages.intent: There is/are를 수량표현, 형용사, 전치사구와 결합하여 복잡한 존재·위치 설명을 자연스럽게 한다.
lexset: some, many, few, several, a lot of, noise, traffic, problem, solution, reason, way, place
traps: There's + 복수명사(There's many ✗)
수량사 선택(few vs a few)
형용사 위치(There are problems big ✗)
전치사구 연결(There is a book on the table)

seeds.en: There's a lot of noise outside.

seeds.kr: 책상 위에 책이 몇 권 있어.
seeds.en: There are several books on the desk.
There are few ways to solve it.
There are many places to go.
There's some food in the fridge.

stages.title: 비교 표현 묶음 — as ~ as / not as ~ as / a bit / much
stages.intent: 동등비교(as ~ as), 정도부사(a bit, much, far), 부정 비교를 사용해 세밀한 비교 표현을 자연스럽게 한다.
lexset: tall, fast, expensive, good, interesting, difficult, important, beautiful, comfortable, convenient
traps: as ~ as 구조(as tall than ✗)
정도부사 위치(much more better ✗)
not as ~ as vs not so ~ as
이중 비교(more faster ✗)

seeds.en: It's not as good as that.
It's not as difficult as expected.
It's not as bad as I thought.

stages.title: 비교급 + 상황맥락 — 실생활 선택·판단
stages.intent: 비교급/최상급을 실생활 상황(쇼핑, 선택, 판단)에서 자연스럽게 사용하여 의견을 표현하고 설득한다.
lexset: choose, decide, prefer, recommend, suggest, buy, expensive, cheap, quality, size, color, brand
traps: 비교 없는 비교급(This is better ✗ - better than what?)
추천 표현(You should buy the most expensive ✗)
이유 연결(because it's cheaper)
선호도 표현(I prefer A to B)

seeds.en: Let's go with the most popular one.

stages.title: 수동태 기초 — 현재/과거, 사람·도구 by-구
stages.intent: be + 과거분사로 현재/과거 수동태를 만들고, by-구로 행위자·도구를 자연스럽게 표현한다.
lexset: make, build, write, design, create, repair, clean, teach, sell, buy, deliver, send
traps: by vs with 혼동(by someone vs with something)
시제 일치(is made vs was made)
과거분사 형태(builded ✗ → built)
불필요한 by-구(The door was opened by someone ✗)

seeds.en: This book was written by a famous writer.
Food is made in the restaurant.
The car was repaired at the garage.
This product is made in Korea.
English is spoken all over the world.
This building was designed by a famous architect.
The package will be delivered tomorrow.

stages.title: 조건문 0형 — 일반적 사실 (If + 현재, 현재)
stages.intent: If + 현재시제, 현재시제로 일반적 사실, 자연 법칙, 습관을 자연스럽게 표현한다.
lexset: heat, boil, freeze, rain, sunny, exercise, study, work, eat, drink, sleep, wake up
traps: 시제 혼동(If it will rain ✗ → If it rains)
조건문 구조(If you heat water, it boils)
when vs if 구분(자연법칙엔 when 가능)
콤마 사용(If 절이 앞에 올 때)

seeds.en: If you heat water, it boils.
If you exercise, you get healthy.
If it rains, you get wet.
If you study, your grades improve.
If you sleep late, you feel tired.
If the sun shines, it gets warm.
If you eat a lot, you feel full.
If water freezes, it becomes ice.
If you wake up early, you have more time.
If you work hard, you succeed.

stages.title: 조건문 1형 — 현실적 가정 (If + 현재, will)
stages.intent: If + 현재시제, will + 동사원형으로 미래의 현실적 가능성과 계획을 자연스럽게 표현한다.
lexset: pass, fail, arrive, miss, finish, start, call, come, go, buy, sell, win, lose
traps: if절에 will 사용 금지(If you will come ✗)
주절 시제(you will be happy)
unless = if not 이해
조건 vs 시간(when vs if)

seeds.en: If you pass the exam, I'll congratulate you.
If you're late, you'll miss it.
If it rains, I'll stay home.
If I have time, I'll call you.
If he comes, we'll go together.
If I have money, I'll buy it.
If we finish early, we can meet.
If I arrive, I'll contact you.
If we win, we'll have a party.
If you don't come, I won't wait.

stages.title: 이유·결과 — because/so/therefore/that's why
stages.intent: because, so, therefore, that's why로 이유와 결과를 논리적으로 연결하여 자연스럽게 설명한다.
lexset: tired, busy, late, sick, happy, angry, worried, excited, disappointed, successful
traps: because vs so 동시 사용 금지(Because I'm tired, so I'll rest ✗)
therefore 위치(문장 시작 또는 중간)
that's why 사용법
쉼표 규칙(Because it's late, I'm going home)

seeds.en: I'm tired, so I'll go to bed early.
I stayed home because it was raining.
I couldn't call because I was busy.
I couldn't come because I was sick.
So that's why you were angry.
I couldn't sleep because I was worried.
